part.title: Migrating from the Perl UI
part.section: This section will list some points of interest when migrating from the Perl UI.

chapter.title: CGI transforms
chapter.para: CGI transforms have been re-implemented but sometimes the behaviour on some limit cases (Such as parameters with no values on the left end or right end of the rule) was difficult to figure out from the Perl code.
You'll probably need to check that your existing CGI Transforms works as expected with the new Public UI

chapter.title: Faceted navigation transforms
chapter.para: Faceted navigation transforms have been re-implemented in Groovy (Previously in Perl). Any existing faceted_navigation_transform.cfg will need to be ported to Groovy into faceted_navigation_transform.groovy.

chapter.title: Query transforms
chapter.para: Query transforms have been re-implemented in Groovy (Previously in Perl) and merged with the "custom hook scripts" feature. Any existing query_transform.cfg will need to be ported to Groovy, and placed in a relevant hook script.

chapter.title: Using legacy XML format
chapter.para: The Java Public UI is able to generate legacy xml.cgi format using an XSL transformation. Just use search.legacy as URL controller to trigger the transformation.

Most of the format is correctly emulated but some tags are missing because it was either too complicated to match the new structure with the old one, or because the feature was mostly unused. This is the case for:
